image_credits: Jacopo de’ Barbari, ​View of Venice_, c. 1460/70-before 1516. Woodcut. Minneapolis Institute of Arts
og_description: The popular trend for drones has highlighted an old human desire: to see the world from above and look upon the lives of those below. But how was this desire satisfied in a world before flying and spying? Zoltán Biedermann takes us to Renaissance Italy to find the expression of an earlier form of voyeurism.
